Areas of Assessment.name: Attraction to maintain a constant pipeline of resources

Assessment Criteria.Criteria: Limited focus on attracting candidates through online advertisements without utilizing other sources or outreach methods.
Incorporating online advertisements with additional sources such as referral schemes or career fairs to attract candidates.
Implementing online advertisements and active outreach to targeted candidate pools for attraction and engagement.
Utilizing online advertisements, proactive outreach, and innovative methods to attract and maintain a consistent pipeline of qualified candidates.

Level.Criteria: Selection criteria are vague and not directly related to the job requirements.
Selection criteria are somewhat aligned with the job requirements.
Selection criteria are clearly defined and somewhat aligned with the job requirements.
Selection criteria are clearly defined and closely aligned with the skills and attributes needed for the role.
Lack of communication on selection process and criteria.
Limited communication on the selection process and criteria.
Clear communication on the selection process, criteria, and timeline provided to all candidates.
Transparent communication on the selection process, criteria, and timeline provided to all candidates.
Reliance on a single selection method (e.g., only resume screening).
Limited use of multiple selection methods.
Utilization of multiple methods such as interviews, assessments, references, etc., to evaluate candidates.
Comprehensive use of multiple methods to evaluate candidates effectively.
Inconsistent evaluation criteria applied to different candidates.
Some consistency in evaluation criteria applied to all candidates.
Consistent evaluation criteria applied to all candidates to ensure fairness.
Rigorous consistency in evaluation criteria applied to all candidates.
Unconscious biases influencing the selection process.
Some measures in place to mitigate biases.
Efforts made to mitigate biases and ensure fair evaluation of all candidates.
Comprehensive measures in place to mitigate biases and ensure a fair evaluation process.
Lack of feedback or communication with candidates throughout the process.
Limited feedback provided to candidates.
Providing timely feedback and a positive experience for all candidates, regardless of the outcome.
Exceptional candidate experience provided with timely feedback and support.
Candidates are not assessed for their fit with the job role and organizational culture.
Some assessment of job fit conducted.
Evaluation includes assessing candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit with the organization.
Thorough assessment of candidates for their fit with the job role and organizational culture.

Score Assessment.Assessment Criteria: Validity and Reliability of Selection Methods

Level.Criteria: Selection methods are not validated or reliable in predicting candidate performance.
Some validation and reliability in selection methods.
Use of validated and reliable selection methods to assess candidates' potential for success.
Extensive use of validated and reliable selection methods to accurately assess candidates' potential for success.
Limited or outdated training programs that do not align with employees' career goals and organizational needs.
Basic training programs offered sporadically with minimal opportunities for career advancement.
Regular training opportunities aligned with employees' career paths and skill development needs.
Comprehensive and personalized training and development programs that support employees' continuous learning and career progression.
Absence of formal recognition programs or rewards for employee achievements, leading to low morale and motivation.
Limited recognition efforts with occasional rewards for outstanding performance.
Consistent recognition initiatives and rewards for employees' accomplishments.
Robust recognition and rewards system that celebrates achievements and incentivizes high performance.
Lack of policies supporting work-life balance, leading to high stress levels and burnout among employees.
Limited flexibility in work arrangements or minimal support for personal well-being.
Policies promoting work-life balance, such as flexible hours and wellness programs.
Comprehensive work-life balance initiatives, including wellness programs, mental health support, and flexible work arrangements tailored to individual needs.
